# Security Policy

## Supported Versions

The following table shows which versions of this project are currently supported with security updates.

| Version | Supported |
|---------|-----------|
| main    | ✔️ Active |
| <older> | ❌ No longer supported |

If you are using an older version, please upgrade to the latest release to ensure you receive security fixes.

---

## Reporting a Vulnerability

If you discover a security vulnerability, please **do not** open a public issue.

Instead, please report it responsibly by contacting:

**security contact:** <your-email@example.com>  
(or use GitHub’s private security advisories if available)

Please include:

- A clear description of the issue  
- Steps to reproduce (if applicable)  
- Any proof-of-concept code  
- Potential impact

We will acknowledge receipt as soon as possible.

---

## Expected Response Process

1. We confirm the vulnerability and assess its severity.  
2. We work on a fix and prepare a security advisory.  
3. We release a patch and publish disclosure notes.  

We aim to respond to reports within **X days** (customize this to your preference).

---

## Security Best Practices for Users

To keep your installation secure:

- Always use the latest stable version.
- Review configuration settings before deployment.
- Avoid exposing sensitive endpoints publicly.
- Rotate any credentials used with this project.

---

## Thank You

We appreciate and encourage responsible disclosure to help keep this project and its users safe.
